lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people to develop their own sustainable business instead of just waiting for charity.
lenders.occupational_info:
Zwei grundlegende Probleme sehe ich bei der Atomkraftnutzung:

Das erste Problem ist der Mensch selbst. Wo Menschen arbeiten, passieren Fehler und Selbstüberschätzungen, früher oder später, unvermeidlich. Tote im Straßenverkehr, ärztliche Kunstfehler, Finanzkrisen.

Ein schwerer Störfall bei einem Atomkraftwerk nur alle hunderttausend Jahre (auch das eine menschliche Einschätzung, s.o.)? Wie schnell tausend Jahre vorbei sein können, hat man in der Geschichte doch schon öfters gesehen.

Und die möglichen Folgen sind nahezu unbegrenzt. Wir spielen "Alles oder Nichts".

Das zweite Problem ist der radioaktive Abfall. Die sichere Lagerung über Jahrhunderttausende ist gnadenloser (Selbst)betrug. (Etwas von Problem 1 steckt hier auch noch mit drin.)

Als Ausgleich für diese Bedrohungen wird nun (März 2010) eine Abschöpfung eines Teils - vielleicht der Hälfte - der zusätzlichen Gewinne (geschätzt 400 - 800 Mio. pro AKW und Jahr) für die "Energieforschung" in die Diskussion gebracht.

Das hört sich ja super an, für 2,50 - 5,00 € pro Bundesbürger und Jahr für jedes Kernkraftwerk sollen wir prinzipiell unbegrenzte Risiken tragen und die Büchse der Pandora mit noch mehr Atommüll füllen?

Ich weiß wirklich nicht, was diese Volksvertreter umtreibt und hoffe, dass dieser Wahnsinn jetzt endlich ein Ende findet.

Es läßt sich doch auch niemand für einen Euro ein paar Tage lang irgendwo auf Bahngeleise ketten - selbst wenn die Schienen rostig sind!

Thomas

Im übrigen bin ich der Meinung, dass alle Atomkraftwerke so schnell wie möglich abgeschaltet werden müssen.

lenders.name: Terran
lenders.loan_because: I feel loaning is the right thing to do. I have hundreds of dollars sitting in my bank account, not being spent and not helping anyone. Micro-credits is a system that allows me to loan that money out to others who desperately need it, while also assuring that it will be refunded for later use.
lenders.occupational_info: I have been studying the micro-credit model for the past few months in my independent study class. I first became fascinated by this during an international relations class, but was disappointed when the class voted against using micro-credits for our community service project. Micro-credits are better then donations because they promote sustainability and economic growth in poverty stricken areas. Lifting countries out of poverty is going to be the key to succession when approaching the concept of globalization.

lenders.name: andrew
lenders.occupation: retired 11B now dedicated 4 victims of cancer
lenders.loan_because:
myspace.com/my-ny 
I too have a natural desire to help life live.  Everybody has the opportunity to be a small light in a dark room my adoptive mother Ferne Northcutt and her husband my father George Northcutt taught me to live good you must love right and to love right you must know GOD.  Someone greater than me gave me life and sustained my life and put the greatest people in the world in my life.  Maybe someone will feel the love and honor i felt
lenders.occupational_info:
To Cancer:

This is war!
You killed my Mother
You killed my Father
You killed my Brother
You killed my Aunts
You killed my Friends.
But before…Should you be successful enough to kill me
All will know you before you arrive, and they will not be
Afraid, alone unprepared or overwhelmed
No, they will fight you and whether through God and or man
We shall win!


Sincerely,
Andrew Northcutt, MYNY





MYNY                                      
           Thank you for reading:   

    This is an introduction to a new Grass Root Non-Profit organization to provide casual assistance for patients within the local hospitals, victim’s family and friends of cancer and mental health.

Cancer has taken a dear friend of mine Paul Williams of Bellport.  My Biological mother Maddy Collins, my mom Ferne Northcutt, my brother Kevin Northcutt, my Father George Northcutt, my Aunt Bobby, my Aunt June and my sisters dog Ditto all in 4 years.  The remaining of my immediate family had the honor of directly caring for my mother, father and brother.  We were able to keep them home as long as medically possible.  During this time the Ignorance of the disease was the main source of frustration.  The emotional, psychological and financial toll was and is beyond ones true comprehension until personally involved, at least for me it was.
MYNY is going to attempt to fill a void recognized by my family over the last 4 years dealing with this disease.  As much time my family and I spent in the hospital we never received a knock on our door or so much as a telephone call from any of the hundreds of cancer org.  Now this is not a derogatory statement toward the great work these cancer or. Do…It means to our family that our community needs some foot soldiers to help bring all this information directly to the patients and their families.
Some patients are alone and some families are alone.  Flowers for the rooms, telephones and televisions are a few ideas for Casual Assistance.  Casual Assistance is a term developed by our family as a non-aggressive non-corporate feeding form of assistance.  We would like to develop a person to patient, person to family’s relationship.  Providing as much information as possible and making available where to obtain all information desired or required.  A family member or loved one often times doesn’t know where to begin and between hospital visits, doctors, work and household obligations one often doesn’t have time to search.  MYNY wants to provide an email address that will return a response immediately an internet address that will directly link you to the organization that can satisfy your needs and a local phone number that a human being who cares will answer and results in a human being showing up.


One day regrettably you will be faced with this disease and with MYNY you will not have to take the time to riddle through search engines or not know how to help.  There will be a knock at your door or a call, it will be a local person and we will care and understand.
Depression

Before a tear was called such a thing
Before sorrow was recognized as such
Before the sounds of one’s voice was a language
Depression was alone. 
No one to see the liquid form your eye
No one to hug your sorrow
No one to understand your voice
Depression was alone.
We wipe the weakness from our eye
We imprison the sorrow within
We disguise the language of our voice
Help us!
To cry aloud without feeling your discomfort
Try to understand my sorrow without the impatience of time
Learn my language so my voice has meaning
And I will love you forever.

Andrew Northcutt, MYNY





Mental illness comes into focus with cancer because of my own personal experience.  Due to such tragedy 4 years, 24/7 watching a disease slowly kill my family depression set in and I displayed all the characteristics of the disease.  However, because of the lack of knowledge my family and myself had no one within my circle recognized the symptoms and the result was a suicide attempt and a week in Brookhaven Hospital psyche ward.
Ask yourself how many times your body became ill.  How many times have your lungs coughed for a couple of days or your nose sneezed for as many days.  These illnesses were caused mostly by your body taking in a virus or bacteria (ingesting, breathing or absorb).  Well, your mind can become ill the same way and or by absorbing negative information physically and chemically.  In my personal case it was the psychological, emotional overload of my family dying day by day for 4 years.
Mental illness is a Scary-Taboo type phrase although there are many more people mentally ill than one might think.  Anytime someone does something where the result will be negative for one-self or someone else that is a reflection of Mental illness.  Something as simple and accepted as smoking cigarettes or a grand as war equals mental illness.  Mental illness is a plague the whole world suffers from but because of its taboo spirit we ignore it or condone it so it will pass us by.  The persons who can’t turn their back are sitting in the hospitals and have very little knowledge or understanding of what illness they or their loved one is suffering or what to expect from the illness depending on what side of the illness you are on.  I salute the brave men and women who care for those in their care.
MYNY  is humbly asking for support from individuals, business and the different faiths of our community our NY.  Should you feel comfortable with supporting such an organization let us know by email,  zaiya10@gmail.com or telephone 631.286.0319 Website Face book and Twitter will be coming soon we are working with CharityNetUSA.com to develop all aspects of MYNY.  
As of February 2010 MYNY is finally in the groundbreaking stage.  The Incorporation and 501c3 along with other legalities will be handled by Myrna Alverio of Charity Net USA the cost will be 500 to 700 dollars with an additional 400 to 800 dollars in state fees.  Feel free to help out….Thank you.
AS of February 23 MYNY spoke with Gerry Garofallou a board member of a MothersKiss.org which is a Non-Profit that is an all volunteer organization dedicated to the families of childhood cancer patients. Since 1994 it has been our goal to help these very special families on both an emotional and financial level.  Andrew Northcutt CEO and Founder of MYNY has explained MYNY purpose and after humbly offering MYNY as a resource gratefully accepted the responsibility to assist A Mothers Kiss in any way possible for the benefit of A Mothers Kiss.
 

Andrew Northcutt 
MYNY
246 station rd 
Bellport NY 11713
631.286.0319
Zaiya10@gmail.com

lenders.name: AJK
lenders.loan_because: The "butterfly effect"-- we are all connected in this world in our time together-- especially now more than ever-- economically as well as spirituality.  Maximizing our individual potentials implies maximizing our human "game space" and recognizing that that space is not a zero-sum field anymore-- if it ever even was.
lenders.occupational_info: I do private wealth management-- particularly due diligence for high net worth individuals researching investment opportunities in the "developing" world-- sorta like Kiva but seeking out larger enterprises and projects instead of individual entrepreneurs.   Mostly I work in the former Soviet republics and Latin America.   It can involve a lot of travel in challenging circumstances at times... but it is exciting to see the magic of a shrinking global village as it happens and participate directly in it.  I especially enjoy and find satisfying seeing how accelerating technological advances like inexpensive mobile phones can be leveraged to improve peoples' lives while making the world more prosperous and economic activity more efficient and sustainable.
